meanings.sent1: After eating, the cow redigests its food to extract more nutrients.
meanings.sent2: She redigests the information from the book to better understand it.
meanings.sent3: The student redigests the math problem, hoping for a different answer.
meanings.sent4: Her mind redigests the memories of her childhood, bringing back vivid images.
meanings.sent5: The chef redigests the recipe in his mind before starting to cook.

meanings.definition: To rework or revise a previously digested material.
meanings.sent1: The author redigests his manuscript to improve the storyline.
meanings.sent2: He redigests the report to correct any errors.
meanings.sent3: The comedian redigests his jokes to make them funnier for the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist redigests his sketches, adding more details to the final drawing.
meanings.sent5: The teacher redigests the lesson plan to make it more engaging for the students.
